item.title: Larissa add a quote by Elizabeth Zimmermann
item.description: "Really, all you need to become a good knitter are wool, needles, hands, and slightly below-average intelligence. Of course superior intelligence, such as yours and mine, is an advantage." -- Elizabeth Zimmermann

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Ann Shayne
item.description: "What do I believe? I believe that it's easier to sit at home in your yoga pants, with your Lean Cuisine Cafe Classic Fettuccine Alfredo. But it's important not to." -- Ann Shayne

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Ambrose Redmoon
item.description: "Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear." -- Ambrose Redmoon

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Let others praise ancient times; I am glad I was born in these." -- Ovid

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Mary Doria Russell
item.description: "Watching him with one eye, she wondered if men ever figured out that they were more appealing when they were pursuing their own work than when they were pursuing a woman." -- Mary Doria Russell

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Elizabeth Zimmerman
item.description: "Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either." -- Elizabeth Zimmerman

item.title: Larissa add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
